subject: Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Billy Gillispie has still not signed a formal contract, more than seven months after agreeing to become Kentucky’s men’s coach.Gillispie is employed under a two-page memorandum of understanding, which details his compensation package, Athletic Director Mitch Barnhart said yesterday. Barnhart did not say what had delayed negotiations. Gillispie, who has a seven-year agreement that pays him $2.3 million a year in base salary, does not have an agent and has declined to discuss the matter during preseason news conferences.
